summary: This bill, the César E. Chávez and the Farmworker Movement National Historical Park Act, aims to establish a national historical park to honor the legacy of César Chávez and the farmworker movement. It redesignates the existing César E. Chávez National Monument, expands the park's boundaries to include additional sites in California and Arizona, and mandates a general management plan. The bill also calls for a study on the Farmworker Peregrinación National Historic Trail, the route of a 1966 march.
